section.name: Installation
section.p:
Steps to make Crank Code Generator running:
Download all required prerequisited, check section Prerequisites for a list of them
Install Maven2: Follow the instructions of Maven2 installation. Check out the version of installed Maven2, when succeded: > mvn -version Example output: Maven version: 2.0.9 Java version: 1.5.0_06 OS name: "windows xp" version: "5.1" arch: "x86" Family: "windows"
Download and install SVN client for your OS For example, TortoiseSVN for Windows
Install Crank dependencies: Before starting with Crank Codegen tool, you are required to install Crank dependencies first:
Check out sources from Crank SVN repository: # Non-members may check out a read-only working copy anonymously over HTTP.
svn checkout http://krank.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ krank-read-only Build and deploy Crank dependencies using Mavn2 and corresponding pom.xml file, as follows: > mvn clean install
Download and install Ant Follow the instructions of Ant installation. Check out the version of installed Ant, when succeded: > ant -version Example output: Apache Ant version 1.6.5 compiled on June 2 2005
Compile and deploy Crank Codegen
For installing Crank Codegen, you have to check out its sources from SVN repository: # Non-members may check out a read-only working copy anonymously over HTTP. svn checkout http://krank.googlecode.com/svn/crank-codegen/ krank-read-only
Then, if Maven2 was properly installed, use the following command to compile and deploy Crank Codegen. You will get compiled binary classes in /target directory, and deployed crank codegen jar into your local M2 repository: > mvn clean install
Example output:
Apache Ant version 1.6.5 compiled on June 2 2005
